title: Mail (com.apple.mail.managed)
description: The payload that configures a Mail account.

EmailAccountType.title: Account Type
EmailAccountType.description: Defines the protocol to use for the account.

EmailAccountDescription.title: Account Description
EmailAccountDescription.description: A user-visible description of the email account, shown in the Mail and Settings applications.

IncomingMailServerIMAPPathPrefix.title: Path Prefix
IncomingMailServerIMAPPathPrefix.description: The path prefix for the IMAP mail server.

EmailAccountName.title: User Display Name
EmailAccountName.description: The full user name for the account. The system displays this name in sent messages.

EmailAddress.title: Email Address
EmailAddress.description: The full email address for the account. If this string isn't present in the payload, the device prompts the user for this string during interactive profile installation in Settings or System Preferences.

IdentificationUUID.title: IdentificationUUID
IdentificationUUID.description: The UUID of the Identification Payload to use as the source for the user email and username values.

PreventMove.title: Allow user to move messages from this account
PreventMove.description: If 'true', the system prevents moving messages out of this email account and into another account. It also prevents forwarding or replying from an account other than the recipient of the message.

disableMailRecentsSyncing.title: Allow recent addresses to be synced
disableMailRecentsSyncing.description: If 'true', the system excludes this account from Recent Addresses syncing.

allowMailDrop.title: Allow Mail Drop
allowMailDrop.description: If 'true', the system enables this account to use Mail Drop.

PreventAppSheet.title: Use Only In Mail
PreventAppSheet.description: If 'true', the system prevents this account from sending mail in any app other than the Apple Mail app.

SMIMEEnabled.title: S/MIME Enabled
SMIMEEnabled.description: If 'true', the system enables S/MIME encryption. The system ignores this key in iOS 10.0 and later.

SMIMESigningEnabled.title: S/MIME Signing Enabled
SMIMESigningEnabled.description: If 'true', the system enables S/MIME signing for this account.

SMIMESigningCertificateUUID.title: S/MIME Signing Certificate
SMIMESigningCertificateUUID.description: The payload UUID of the identity certificate used to sign messages sent from this account.

SMIMEEncryptionEnabled.title: S/MIME Encryption Enabled
SMIMEEncryptionEnabled.description: If 'true', the system enables S/MIME encryption for this account.

SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUID.title: S/MIME Encryption Certificate
SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUID.description: The UUID of the identity certificate used to decrypt messages sent to this account. The system attaches the public certificate to outgoing mail to allow the user to receive encrypted mail. When the user sends encrypted mail, the system uses the public certificate to encrypt the copy of the mail in their Sent mailbox.

SMIMEEnablePerMessageSwitch.title: S/MIME Enable Per-Message Switch
SMIMEEnablePerMessageSwitch.description: If 'true', the system displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI. Deprecated in iOS 12.0. Use 'SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch' instead.

SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.title: Enable S/MIME toggle
SMIMESigningUserOverrideable.description: If 'true', the user can turn S/MIME signing on or off in Settings.

SMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea.title: Enable user to select the signing identity
SMIMESigningCertificateUUIDUserOverridea.description: If 'true', the user can select the signing identity.

SMIMEEncryptByDefault.title: Enable S/MIME by default
SMIMEEncryptByDefault.description: If 'true', the system enables S/MIME encryption by default.

SMIMEEncryptByDefaultUserOverrideable.title: Enable user to toggle S/MIME by default
SMIMEEncryptByDefaultUserOverrideable.description: If 'true', the user can turn encryption by default on/off, and encryption is on.

SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUIDUserOverri.title: Enable user to select the signing identity and encryption is enabled
SMIMEEncryptionCertificateUUIDUserOverri.description: If 'true', the user can select the S/MIME encryption identity, and encryption is on.

SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch.title: Enable per-message encryption switch
SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch.description: If 'true', the system displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI.

IncomingMailServerHostName.title: Incoming Mail Server Hostname
IncomingMailServerHostName.description: The incoming mail server host name.

IncomingMailServerPortNumber.title: Incoming Mail Server Port
IncomingMailServerPortNumber.description: The incoming mail server port number. If not set, the system uses the default port for a given protocol.

IncomingMailServerUsername.title: Incoming Mail Server Username
IncomingMailServerUsername.description: The user name for the email account, usually the same as the email address up to the "@" character. If not set and the account requires authentication for incoming email, the device prompts the user for this string during interactive profile installation in Settings or System Preferences.

IncomingMailServerAuthentication.title: Incoming Mail Server Authentification Type
IncomingMailServerAuthentication.description: The authentication scheme for incoming mail.

IncomingPassword.title: Incoming Mail Server Password
IncomingPassword.description: The password for the incoming mail server. Only use this in encrypted profiles.

IncomingMailServerUseSSL.title: Incoming Mail Server Use SSL
IncomingMailServerUseSSL.description: If 'true', the system enables SSL for authentication on the incoming mail server.

OutgoingMailServerHostName.title: Outgoing Mail Server Hostname
OutgoingMailServerHostName.description: The outgoing mail server host name.

OutgoingMailServerPortNumber.title: Outgoing Mail Server Port
OutgoingMailServerPortNumber.description: The outgoing mail server port number. If not set, the system uses ports 25, 587, and 465, in that order.

OutgoingMailServerUsername.title: Outgoing Mail Server Username
OutgoingMailServerUsername.description: The user name for the email account, usually the same as the email address up to the "@" character. If not set and the account requires authentication for outgoing email, the device prompts the user for this string during interactive profile installation in Settings or System Preferences.

OutgoingMailServerAuthentication.title: Outgoing Mail Server Authentication Type
OutgoingMailServerAuthentication.description: The authentication scheme for outgoing mail.

OutgoingPassword.title: Outgoing Mail Server Password
OutgoingPassword.description: The password for the outgoing mail server. Only use this in encrypted profiles.

OutgoingPasswordSameAsIncomingPassword.title: Outgoing Password Same As Incoming
OutgoingPasswordSameAsIncomingPassword.description:
If 'true', the system prompts the user only once for the password, which it uses for both outgoing and incoming mail.

This setting is only supported by interactive profile installations. Not supported by non-interactive installations, such as MDM on iOS.

OutgoingMailServerUseSSL.title: Outgoing Mail Server Use SSL
OutgoingMailServerUseSSL.description: If 'true', the system enables SSL authentication on the outgoing mail server.

VPNUUID.title: VPNUUID
VPNUUID.description: The VPNUUID of the per-app VPN the account uses for network communication. Available in iOS 14 and later.
